titleStmt.title: Max Fiedler
born Zittau, Dec 31, 1859; died Stockholm, Dec 1, 1939

body.head: Max Fiedler
body.p: German conductor and composer known for his interpretations of Brahms.

div.head: Career summary
div.p: Having studied at the Cologne Conservatory 1877â€’80, he was appointed a teacher at the Hamburg Conservatory in 1882, becoming its director in 1903. Having been a concert pianist early in his career, he turned to conducting and became conductor of the Hamburg Philharmonic Society in 1904. He was guest conductor of many foreign and German orchestras.
